intro: Eranthemum argenteum, commonly known as silver eranthemum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking silver-white foliage and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its leaves are covered in a fine layer of hair, giving them their distinctive silvery appearance. Eranthemum argenteum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
